newsitem.title: FRANCE: SOCCER-CANNES HOLD PSG 1-1 AT PARC DES PRINCES.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-CANNES HOLD PSG 1-1 AT PARC DES PRINCES.

text.p: Midfielder Cedric Daury scored a shock equaliser as Cannes held crisis-ridden Paris St Germain 1-1 in the French first division at the Parc des Princes on Saturday.
PSG, desperate for a first home win since early November, went ahead with striker Cyrille Pouget's first league goal for the club in the 12th minute.
PSG remain six points adrift of leaders Monaco who will pull nine clear if they win at Lyon on Sunday.
Guinean striker Aboubacar Camara scored twice as Lens beat Guingamp 2-1 at home to end a nine-match run without victory.
Nantes stretched their unbeaten run in the league to 18 games with a 1-0 win at Metz. Midfielder Jocelyn Gourvenec scored one minute after the interval.

Midfielder Laurant Huard saved Rennes' unbeaten home record with a 66th minute equaliser in their 1-1 draw with lowly Caen, who had defender Stephane Moreau sent off nine minutes from time for violent play.
